metadata.synopsis: Lawman John Corbett (Lee Van Cleef) searches the U.S.-Mexico border for a Mexican peasant (Tomas Milian) accused of raping and killing a 12-year-old girl.

reviews: It's a wonderful film, rich with style and loaded with surprises, with a fluid storytelling touch that brings substance to a genre that's often concerned solely with appearance.
A fun and exciting Western thriller...
The U.S. premiere of this surprisingly thoughtful 1960s spaghetti western gives an opportunity to reflect on the genre.
Even if Van Cleef is a one-dimensional actor, he nevertheless has a tremendous screen presence.
